bug.short_desc: Having >20 addons enabled causes hanging when opening extensions under Add-on Manager

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20110321 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20110321 Firefox/4.0
I restarted FireFox numerous times and it was only after I restarted in safe mode and disabled all add-ons was I able to isolate the problem of it being onlt if there are 20 enabled.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Pick any 20 add-ons 2. Add them to FireFox My list: Adblock Plus Adblock Plus Pop-up Addon Tabmix Plus Add to Search Bar ColorZilla Menu Editor HackBar Firegesture Console2 NoScript Tamper Data BetterPrivacy Omnibar Vacuum Places Improved Multi Links Ressurect Pages Screengrab Beef Taco Download Statusbar Greasemonkey IdentFavIcon iMacros for Firefox Organize Status bar StumbleUpon Video Download Helper Modify Headers Cookieculler LocationBar2 Web Developer Flagfox Live IP Address 3. Tools -> Add-ons -> Extensions Actual Results: Gray area looking like it has yet to draw to the screen the extensions menu and then a total failure of Firefox causing it to end up hanging/freezing.
Expected Results: Loaded the extensions menu as normal.
OS : Arch i646 Theme : Both Default & Abstract Black (Persona) Windows Manager : Xorg running Musca Build : Straight from distro's main repos
I'm sorry. It's when there are >20 extensions enabled.
